turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Reserve judge.
turn.1: What is the difference between a reservist and a regular judge
turn.2: Reserve judge A reserve judge is a former judge or, on occasion, an appointed official who offers their services as a substitute judge when required.
turn.4: Reserve judges either supplement judges in jurisdictions that do not have the number of judges needed, or act as an alternate judge in jurisdictions with a single judge when that judge is substituted or must recuse himself.
turn.6: Reserve judges may also be used as substitutes when another judge is ill or on vacation.
turn.8: A reserve judge is distinguished from a commissioner in that a reserve judge is meant for intermittent, temporary work only, not as a permanent solution.
turn.10: Reserve judges may handle any cases a normal judge can handle, whereas commissioners are more limited in their authority.
